info.title: Message Processing Logs
info.description:
Message processing logs enable you to store data about the messages processed on a tenant and - for each processed message - information about the individual processing steps.  
This API is implemented based on OData version 2 specification.

externalDocs.description: SAP Cloud Integration documentation: OData API - Message Monitoring

x-sap-shortText: Get an overview of the messages processed on a tenant and get the details for individual messages.

x-servers.description: SAP Cloud Integration REST API Endpoint

Account Short Name.description: SAP BTP subaccount short name where Cloud Integration is provided

x-servers.description: SAP Cloud Integration Custom Domain Endpoint - see [Configuring Custom Domains](https://help.sap.com/viewer/368c481cd6954bdfa5d0435479fd4eaf/Cloud/en-US/7230b9ff41914cc0969223e6a020104b.html)

Custom Name.description: Your defined name for your Cloud Integration account.

get.description:
Get all message processing logs.
In API sandbox the available integration flows provide the following log information: * '__Integration Flow with Message Store entries - COMPLETED PROCESSING__': Attachments and message store entries * '__Integration Flow with Adapter Data - FAILED PROCESSING__': Message processing log error information, attachments, custom header properties and adapter data

parameters.name: $inlinecount
parameters.description: Count the number of retrieved entries by selecting ```allpages```.

parameters.name: $filter
parameters.description:
Filter items by property values.
For any Id filter use only the 'eq' operator.
Example: ```Status eq 'FAILED'``` returns message processing logs with status 'FAILED'.
IntegrationFlowName is deprecated. In queries filtering for IntegrationFlowName, this will be substituted automatically by IntegrationFlow/Id

parameters.name: $orderby
parameters.description:
Order items by property values.
IntegrationFlowName is deprecated.

parameters.name: $select
parameters.description: Select properties to be returned.

IntegrationArtifact.Name: Integration Flow with Adapter Data - FAILED PROCESSING
Integration Flow with Adapter Data - FAILED PROCESSING

get.description:
You can use the following request to get message processing log by message Guid.
In API sandbox the integration flows provide the following log information: * '__Integration Flow with message store entries COMPLETED PROCESSING__': Attachments and message store entries * '__Integration Flow with Adapter Data - FAILED PROCESSING__': Message processing log error information, attachments, custom header properties and adapter data
get.summary: Get message processing log by message Guid.

parameters.name: MessageGuid
parameters.description: Guid of the message for which the message processing log is written

parameters.name: $select
parameters.description: Select properties to be returned.

parameters.name: $expand
parameters.description: Expand related entities.

IntegrationArtifact.Name: Integration Flow with Adapter Data - FAILED PROCESSING

get.description: You can use the following request to get number of all message processing logs.
get.summary: Get number of all message processing logs.

parameters.name: $filter
parameters.description:
Filter items by property values.
For any Id filter use only the 'eq' operator.
Example: ```Status eq 'FAILED'``` returns the number of message processing logs with status 'FAILED'
IntegrationFlowName is deprecated. In queries filtering for IntegrationFlowName, this will be substituted automatically by IntegrationFlow/Id.

200.description: Number of retrieved message processing logs

get.description:
You can use the following request to get the adapter attributes of the message processing log with the specified message Guid.
In API sandbox only the deployed integration flow '__Integration Flow with Adapter Data - FAILED PROCESSING__' provides the required adapter data
get.summary: Get adapter attributes of message processing log by message Guid.

parameters.name: MessageGuid
parameters.description: Guid of the message for which the message processing log is written

parameters.name: $select
parameters.description: Select properties to be returned.

200.description: Retrieved message processing log adapter attributes

get.description:
You can use the following request to get the attachments of the message processing log with the specified message Guid.
In API sandbox the following integration flows provide the required message processing log attachments: * '__Integration Flow with message store entries COMPLETED PROCESSING__' * '__Integration Flow with Adapter Data FAILED PROCESSING__'
get.summary: Get attachments of message processing log by message Guid.

parameters.name: MessageGuid
parameters.description: Guid of the message for which the message processing log is written

get.description:
You can use the following request to get custom header properties of message processing log with the specified message Guid.
In API sandbox only the deployed integration flow '__Integration Flow with Adapter Data - FAILED PROCESSING__' provides the required custom header properties
get.summary: Get custom header properties of message processing log by message Guid.

parameters.name: MessageGuid
parameters.description: Guid of the message for which the message processing log is written

parameters.name: $filter
parameters.description: Filter items by property values

parameters.name: $orderby
parameters.description: Order items by property values

parameters.name: $select
parameters.description: Select properties to be returned.

get.description:
You can use the following request to get error information for the message with the specified message Guid.
In API sandbox only the deployed integration flow '__Integration Flow with Adapter Data - FAILED PROCESSING__' provides the required error information
get.summary: Get error information of message processing log by message Guid.

parameters.name: MessageGuid
parameters.description: Guid of the message for which the message processing log is written

get.description:
You can use the following request to get error information text for the message with the specified message Guid.
In API sandbox only the deployed integration flow '__Integration Flow with Adapter Data - FAILED PROCESSING__' provides the required error information
get.summary: Get error information text of message processing log by message Guid.

parameters.name: MessageGuid
parameters.description: Guid of the message for which the message processing log is written

get.description: You can use the following request to get all target Ids for the given source Id, which are stored in the Id mapper.
get.summary: Get all target Ids for the given source Id.

parameters.name: Source ID
parameters.description: Source Id, which is stored in the Id mapper

get.description: You can use the following request to get all source Ids for the given target Id, which are stored in the Id mapper.
get.summary: Get source Ids for a given target Id

parameters.name: Target ID
parameters.description: Target Id, which is stored in the Id mapper

get.description:
This path is deprecated. Please use the __/GenericIdempotentRepositoryEntries__ path.
You can use the following request to get entries from Idempotent Repository with the same id.
get.summary: Get Idempotent Repository entries by id.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Entry ID of Idempotent Repository - for SFTP adapter <source directory>/<file name> and for XI adapter the XI message ID needs to be entered.

get.description:
This path is deprecated. Please use the __/GenericIdempotentRepositoryEntries__ path.
You can use the following request to get entry from Idempotent Repository by hex encoded source and entry values.

parameters.name: HexSource
parameters.description: Hex encoded processor, which is either <user@host> for SFTP adapter or a generated ID for XI adapter.

parameters.name: HexEntry
parameters.description: Hex encoded entry ID, which is either <source directory>/<file name> for SFTP adapter or XI message ID for XI adapter.

500.description: Internal server error - parameter values are not provided in the expected hex encoded format.

message.value: Problem during reading an idempotent repository entry with source null and entry null

delete.description:
This path is deprecated. Please use the __/GenericIdempotentRepositoryEntries__ path.
You can use the following request to delete entry from Idempotent Repository.
In API sandbox only read APIs could be tested. You need to configure an API endpoint for your account, where you have the required write permissions to delete entries from the Idempotent Repository.

parameters.name: HexSource
parameters.description: Hex encoded processor, which is either <user@host> for SFTP adapter or a generated ID for XI adapter.

parameters.name: HexEntry
parameters.description: Hex encoded Entry ID, which is either <source directory>/<file name> for SFTP adapter or XI message ID for XI adapter.
CSRF token that is valid for the current session (see resource 'CSRF Token Handling')
parameters.name: X-CSRF-Token

204.description: Success or entry does not exist.

500.description: Internal server error - parameter values are not provided in the expected hex encoded format.

message.value: Problem during deletion of an idempotent repository entry with source null and entry null

get.description: You can use the following request to get entries from Idempotent Repository with the same id.
get.summary: Get Idempotent Repository entries by id.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Entry ID of Idempotent Repository - for SFTP adapter <source directory>/<file name> and for XI adapter the XI message ID needs to be entered.

get.description: You can use the following request to get entry from Idempotent Repository by hex encoded vendor, source, entry and component values.

parameters.name: HexVendor
parameters.description: Hex encoded value of the vendor (e.g. adapter provider) - example value: 'SAP'.

parameters.name: HexSource
parameters.description: Hex encoded processor, which is either <user@host> for SFTP adapter or a generated ID for XI adapter.

parameters.name: HexEntry
parameters.description: Hex encoded entry ID, which is either <source directory>/<file name> for SFTP adapter or XI message ID for XI adapter.

parameters.name: HexComponent
parameters.description: Hex encoded value of the component field, e.g. the adapter type/name.

500.description: Internal server error - parameter values are not provided in the expected hex encoded format.

message.value: Problem during reading an idempotent repository entry with source null and entry null

delete.description:
You can use the following request to delete entry from Idempotent Repository.
In API sandbox only read APIs could be tested. You need to configure an API endpoint for your account, where you have the required write permissions to delete entries from the Idempotent Repository.

parameters.name: HexVendor
parameters.description: Hex encoded value of the vendor - for example the adapter provider.

parameters.name: HexSource
parameters.description: Hex encoded processor, which is either <user@host> for SFTP adapter or a generated ID for XI adapter.

parameters.name: HexEntry
parameters.description: Hex encoded Entry ID, which is either <source directory>/<file name> for SFTP adapter or XI message ID for XI adapter.

parameters.name: HexComponent
parameters.description: Hex encoded value of the component field, e.g. the adapter type/name.
CSRF token that is valid for the current session (see resource 'CSRF Token Handling')
parameters.name: X-CSRF-Token

204.description: Success or entry does not exist.

500.description: Internal server error - parameter values are not provided in the expected hex encoded format.

message.value: Problem during deletion of an idempotent repository entry with source null and entry null

post.description:
This API is only present in the Cloud Foundry environment. You can use the following request to acitvate external logging on your tenant.
If no response body is returned, there's an authentication issue. Make sure the request is authorized and that your user has the ActivateExternalLogging role.
For more information, see SAP Help Portal documentation at [External Logging](https://help.sap.com/docs/integration-suite/sap-integration-suite/external-logging-cloud-foundry-environment).

parameters.name: defaultLogLevel
parameters.description: Set the default external log level for new or existing integration flows that have no individual external log level configured.
CSRF token that is valid for the current session (see resource 'CSRF Token Handling').
parameters.name: X-CSRF-Token

results: ExternalLogging successfully enabled for tenant xy

500.description:
An error occurred during configuration validation or activation of external logging.
For information on more possible error situations and response bodies, see SAP Help Portal documentation at [Possible Errors During External Logging Activation](https://help.sap.com/docs/integration-suite/sap-integration-suite/possible-errors-during-external-logging-activation).

post.description:
This API is only present in the Cloud Foundry environment. You can use the following request to deacitvate external logging on your tenant.
If no response body is returned, there's an authentication issue. Make sure the request is authorized and that your user has the ActivateExternalLogging role.
For more information, see SAP Help Portal documentation at [External Logging](https://help.sap.com/docs/integration-suite/sap-integration-suite/external-logging-cloud-foundry-environment).

results: External logging successfully disabled for tenant xy

500.description:
An error occurred during deactivation of external logging.
For information on more possible error situations and response bodies, see SAP Help Portal documentation at [Possible Errors During External Logging Activation](https://help.sap.com/docs/integration-suite/sap-integration-suite/possible-errors-during-external-logging-activation).

get.description: This API is only present in the Cloud Foundry environment.
get.summary: Get external logging status for a tenant

parameters.name: TenantName
parameters.description: Tenant name

200.description: Retrieved value for external logging configuration of this tenant

post.description: This API is only present in the Cloud Foundry environment. You can use the following request to acitvate the archiving functionality in your tenant.

results: Archiving successfully enabled for tenant xy

get.description: This API is only present in the Cloud Foundry environment. You can use the following request to acitvate the archiving functionality in your tenant.
get.summary: Get archiving configuration for a tenant

parameters.name: TenantName
parameters.description: Tenant name

200.description: Retrieved value for archiving configuration of this tenant

results: Archiving configured has value: true on tenant xy

get.description: This API is only present in the Cloud Foundry environment. You can use the following request to get the Key Performance Indicators (KPIs) of the archiving runs.
get.summary: Get Key Performance Indicators of the archiving run

parameters.name: $filter
parameters.description:
Filter items by property values.
For any Id filter use only the 'eq' operator.
Example: ```MplsToBeArchived eq 5000```

get.description:
You can use the following request to get the CSRF token for this session, which is required for write access via POST, PUT and DELETE operations. Copy the received X-CSRF-Token from the response header.
**In API sandbox this request is not relevant!**

parameters.description: To retrieve a new CSRF token the value of the header must be set to ```Fetch```.
parameters.name: X-CSRF-Token

200.description: The header provides the CSRF token for this session.

X-CSRF-Token.description: CSRF token that can be used for all modifying requests within the same session.

top.name: $top
top.description: Show only the first n items.

400.description: Bad Request. Wrong format or structure of the provided request body or parameters.

401.description: Unauthorized. Authorization information is missing or invalid.

403.description: Forbidden. The required permissions to access the resource are missing.

404.description: Not found. The requested resource could not be found.

429.description: Too many requests. Servers rate limit exceeded.

500.description: Internal server error. The requested operation led to an error during execution.
